Magna Carta.definition: a charter of liberties signed under duress by King John of England in 1215 that influenced the development of several modern legal and constitutional principles

orMag·na Char·ta[mag-nə-kÄ r-tə].definition: [Medieval Latin, literally, great charter]a charter of liberties signed under duress by King John of England in 1215 that influenced the development of several modern legal and constitutional principles (as due process)
